techmeme.title: China sentences Zhao Weiguo, ex-chair of state-backed chip firm Tsinghua Unigroup, to death with a two-year reprieve, a de facto life sentence, for corruption (Chun Han Wong/Wall Street Journal)
Las Vegas-based TensorWave, which offers AMD-powered cloud infrastructure, raised $100M led by Magnetar and AMD Ventures, taking its total funding to $146.7M (Kyle Wiggers/TechCrunch)
At a JP Morgan event, Intel CFO David Zinsner says committed volumes for Intel's new 18A and 14A chips from external customers are currently "not significant" (Reuters)
Databricks agrees to acquire cloud database startup Neon for ~$1B, set to close in Q2 2025; Neon's platform is based on open-source database PostgreSQL (Belle Lin/Wall Street Journal)
Sources: Guangzhou-based autonomous driving company Pony AI confidentially filed for a Hong Kong IPO; Pony AI raised ~$413M in a US IPO in November 2024 (Bloomberg)
